tasks.title: Add beta/pre-release channel for testing updates before public release
tasks.description:
Set up a pre-release workflow so update flows can be tested end-to-end on Windows (and other platforms) before tagging a release as 'latest'. Key pieces:

1. CI: Ensure tags like v2.3.0-beta.1 trigger the same build pipeline but publish as a GitHub pre-release (GitHub does this automatically for semver pre-release tags — verify electron-builder respects it).
2. App config: Add a way to enable `autoUpdater.allowPrerelease = true` for local testing (env var, CLI flag, or hidden settings toggle — doesn't need to be user-facing).
3. Testing workflow: Document the flow — install previous stable build on Windows, flip the pre-release flag, verify the full update lifecycle (check → download progress → install prompt → clicks still work), then cut the real tag.
4. Optional: Add a pre-release smoke-test checklist to RELEASING.md.

Goal: Never ship six patch releases in a row again because platform-specific updater bugs weren't caught before going public.
